column4: Hello, I'm having a problem with my wireless. I recently reinstalled ubuntu 9.04, and last install, it automatically installed the wireless driver. Now, I don't know if it's installed, but I can't get it active either way.
Does anyone know how to fix this?
you can test this
What am I testing?
ok, hold on
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/266456/
How can I find this?
or can I just not get it?
wlan0 isn't a command
it says: "Failed to read scan data : Resource temporarily unavailable"
That didn't work. If it helps, on my last install, it told me to install drivers to get the card working, but on this install, it didn't work. Same install CD.
broadcom 802.11 b/g wlan
Yes
try typing sudo iwconfig ath0
no such device and interface doesn't support scanning
I know, but I don't know how to get that one back.
Possibly. How do I check that?
Synaptic?
Hardware Drivers?
AH
what is the model of that card?
I found the screen that I saw earlier
This'll fix it, thanks a lot
Oh, and it's BCM43xx if you were woundering
